item.title: Human urine and foul, 7th September
item.description:
Human urine and foul in Craven passage, the passage is used as public toilet every night

item.title: Building materials abandoned on public road and pavement, 7th September
item.description:
Been here for months. Clearly no intention of clearing away after completing a building project at the house. Sand and rubble now being driven over daily by passing cars.

item.title: St George flags Well Hall Pleasaunce, 7th September
item.description:
Numerous St George flags have been painted in locations around our beautiful park including the walls of the bowls clubhouse. I ask that the council remove the paint as soon as possible to stop giving publicity to these fascist thugs who want to damage property and impose their beliefs on those of us who have no interest in their thuggery.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edith Nesbit Walk, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhang of vegetation, 7th September

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackbrook Lane, Southborough, London

item.title: Enfield council neglect of Winchmore Hill, 7th September
item.description:
The council have run down Winchmore Hill so that it resembles a slum. They have enabled unlicensed and increasing HMOs full of men and left fly tipping unchallenged. Businesses are never challenged for waste management and street littering and fly tips and waste sacks and litter are levy for weeks and months uncollected. Streets are not cleansed once a week or at all. It has been a month since Hoppers road and Satation road N21 have been cleaned. The publishe street cleaning rota is not true and the shopping area of green lanes Winchmore Hill is filthy and unkempt and absolutely not cleaned more than once according to the published royal. By Saturday it is riddled with waste and dumped overflowing waste sacks on the street. Bury street west, a far less busy road in Edmonton is cleaned once a week in comparison. A Labour councillor has property here as do the council.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hoppers Road, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: They supposed to collect the recycling bag on Friday they did come and left all the recycling bag on pavement without collection, 7th September
item.description:
Since Friday they didn’t collect it, and this messed was done by dust men not the residents. To be clear they collected from residents and left it on the pavement .

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilton Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
